description: Rear roof extension including alteration of roof from hip to gable (involving conversion of roofspace into habitable use), installation of four rooflights to front roofslope, three rooflights to north side elevation  and three rooflights to south elevation and sub-division of property to form one self-contained unit (one, two bedroom flat)
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers Site Location Plan; SO-421-01; SO-421-02 Rev A; SO-421-03 Rev A; SO-421-04 Rev A; SO-421-05; and Design and Access Statement, prepared by Chalkline Architects dated December 2012, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local Planning Authority.  Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | The roof tiles and bricks to be used in the external surfaces of the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building.  REASON:  To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 7.1, 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan and policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan 2004: Plan for the Environment. | Details of attenuation measures from external noise and vibration together with associated ventilation for the proposed residential accommodation shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority.  The details approved shall be implemented prior to the first occupation of any of the residential units and thereafter permanently retained, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of future occupiers of the residential properties, in accordance with policy 5.3 of the London Plan and policies 4.1 and 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance Note 10 (Noise and Vibration). | Details of a scheme to provide parking for cyclists in accordance with adopted standards shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, and such details as approved shall be implemented and brought into use prior to first occupation and retained permanently.  Reason:  To provide adequate facilities for cyclists, in accordance with policy 6.9 of the London Plan and policy 9.6 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' 2004. | Details of a refuse storage for the residential unit hereby approved shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, and such details as approved shall be implemented and brought into use prior to first occupation and retained permanently.  Reason: To ensure that adequate provision for refuse storage is made within the site, in accordance with the Council's adopted UDP policies 4.1. | Before any part of the development hereby permitted is first occupied, arrangements shall be agreed in writing with the local planning authority and be put in place to ensure that, with the exception of disabled persons, no resident of the [INSERT FLAT NUMBER/ DEVELOPMENT] shall obtain a resident's parking permit (including visitors' permits) within any controlled parking zone which may be in force in the area at any time. The professional and legal fees incurred by the Council in drafting and completing the agreement shall be met by the applicant/owner.  Reason: To ensure that proposal does not exacerbate on-street parking pressure in the local controlled parking zone, in accordance with London Plan 2011 policy 6.13. and policies 9.1 and 9.8 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' 2004/DCLG Direction 2007.
